alert.note: Alert for Madison (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 29 at 1:54PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT EAST CENTRAL MADISON COUNTY THROUGH 215 PM EDT... At 154 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Winston, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Bybee, College Hill, Combs, Panola, Dreyfus, Brassfield, Speedwell and Elliston. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
